item.title: xrange
item.dc:creator: Anton Checkhov
item.content:encoded:
xrange([start,] stop[, step]) -> xrange object

 

    Like range(), but instead of returning a list, returns an object that

    generates the numbers in the range on demand.  For looping, this is 

    slightly faster than range() and more memory efficient.
item.excerpt:encoded: xrange([start,] stop[, step]) -> xrange object Like range(), but instead of returning a list, returns an object that generates the numbers in the range on demand. For looping, this is slightly faster than range() and more memory efficient.
